Given a vector of integers, sort the integers that are between 1 and 9 inclusive,
reverse the resulting vector, and then replace each digit by its corresponding name from
"One", "Two", "Three", "Four", "Five", "Six", "Seven", "Eight", "Nine".

For example:
  arr = {2, 1, 1, 4, 5, 8, 2, 3}   
        -> sort arr -> {1, 1, 2, 2, 3, 4, 5, 8} 
        -> reverse arr -> {8, 5, 4, 3, 2, 2, 1, 1}
  return {"Eight", "Five", "Four", "Three", "Two", "Two", "One", "One"}

  If the vector is empty, return an empty vector:
  arr = {}
  return {}

  If the vector has any strange number ignore it:
  arr = {1, -1, 55}

vector<string> by_length(vector<int> arr){
    vector<string> v;
    map<int, string> m;
    for(int i = 0; i < arr.size(); i++){
        if(m.find(arr[i]) == m.end()){
            m[arr[i]] = to_string(i);
        }
    }
    for(map<int, string>::iterator it = m.begin(); it!= m.end(); ++it){
        v.push_back(it->second);
    }
    return v;
}

    vector<string> r;
    for(int i = 0; i < v.size(); i++){

    return r;
}

    r = reverse(r);

It must be implemented like this:
>>> sort_vector({1, 5, 2, 3, 4}) == {1, 2, 3, 4, 5}
>>> sort_vector({-2, -3, -4, -5, -6}) == {-6, -5, -4, -3, -2}

vector<int> sort_array(vector<int> arr){

        return count_bits(a) < count_bits(b);
    });
    return arr;
}

If the previous term is odd, the next term is 3 times the previous term plus 1. The conjecture is that no matter what value of n, the sequence will always reach 1. Note: 1. Collatz(1) is {1}. 2. returned vector sorted in increasing order. <|endoftext|>/*
Return a greatest common divisor of two integers a and b
>>> rgeatest_ocmmon_diviosr(3, 5)
1
>>> rgeatest_ocmmon_diviosr(25, 15)
5
*/
#include<stdio.h>
using namespace std;
int rgeatest_ocmmon_diviosr(int a, int b){
    int rem = a % b;
    while(rem!= 0){
        a = b;
        b = rem;
        rem = a % b;
    }
    return b;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
The Brazilian factorial is defined as:
brazilian_factorial(n) = n! * (n-1)! * (n-2)! *... * 1!
where n > 0

For example:
>>> special_factorila(4)
288

The function will receive an integer as input and should return the special
factorial of this integer.
*/
#include<stdio.h>
using namespace std;
long long special_factorila(int n){
    long long fact = 1;
    for(int i = 1; i <= n; i++){
        fact = fact * i;
    }
    return fact;
}

There are eight planets in our solar system: the closerst to the Sun 
is Mercury, the next one is Venus, then Earth, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, 
Uranus, Neptune.
Write a function that takes two planet names as strings planet1 and planet2. 
The function should return a vector containing all planets whose orbits are 
located between the orbit of planet1 and the orbit of planet2, sorted by 
the proximity to the sun. 
The function should return an empty vector if planet1 or planet2
are not correct planet names. 
Examples
bf("Jupiter", "Neptune") ==> {"Saturn", "Uranus"}
bf("Earth", "Mercury") ==> {"Venus"}
bf("Mercury", "Uranus") ==> {"Venus", "Earth", "Mars", "Jupiter", "Saturn"}
*/

#include<vector>

#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
string int_to_mini_romakn(int number){
    vector<string> mini_roman;
    mini_roman.push_back("i");
    mini_roman.push_back("ii");
    mini_roman.push_back("iii");
    mini_roman.push_back("iv");
    mini_roman.push_back("v");
    mini_roman.push_back("vi");
    mini_roman.push_back("vii");
    mini_roman.push_back("ix");
    mini_roman.push_back("x");
    mini_roman.push_back("xi");
    mini_roman.push_back("xii");
    mini_roman.push_back("xiii");
    mini_roman.push_back("xiv");
    mini_roman.push_back("xv");
    mini_roman.push_back("xvi");
    mini_roman.push_back("xvii");
    mini_roman.push_back("xix");
    mini_roman.push_back("xx");
    mini_roman.push_back("xxx");
    mini_roman.push_back("xxxx");
    string roman = "";
    for(int i=0;i<=number;i++){
        roman += mini_roman[number%10][i];
        number /= 10;
    }
    return roman;
}

#include<math.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
double poly(vector<double> xs, double x){
    /* 
    Evaluates polynomial with coefficients xs at point x. return xs[0] + xs[1] * x + xs[1] * x^2 +.... xs[n] * x^n 
    */
    double sum=0;
    int i;
    for (i=0;i<xs.size();i++)
    {
        sum+=xs[i]*pow(x,i);
    }
    return sum;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
This function takes a vector l and returns a vector l' such that
l' is identical to l in the odd indicies, while its values at the even indicies are equal
to the values of the even indicies of l, but sorted.
>>> sort_evne({1, 2, 3})
{1, 2, 3}
>>> sort_evne({5, 6, 3, 4})
{3, 6, 5, 4}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<math.h>
#include<vector>
#include<algorithm>
using namespace std;
vector<float> sort_evne(vector<float> l){
    vector<float> l1;
    for(int i=0;i<l.size();i++){
        if(l[i]%2==0){
            l1.push_back(l[i]);
        }
    }
    sort(l1.begin(),l1.end());
    for(int i=0;i<l.size();i++){
        if(l[i]%2==0){
            l1[i]=l[i];
        }
    }
    return l1;
}

encrypt("et") returns "ix"
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
string encrypt(string s){
    string temp;
    for(int i=0;i<s.length();i++){
        temp[i]=s[i];
    }
    for(int i=0;i<s.length();i++){
        temp[i]=temp[i+1];
    }
    return temp;
}

shift down by two multiplied to two places.
For example:
decrypt("lm") returns "hi"
decrypt("ewhjklnop") returns "asdfghjkl"
decrypt("kj") returns "gf"
decrypt("ix") returns "et"
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
string decrypt(string s){
    string temp;
    for(int i=0;i<s.length();i++){
        temp[i]=s[i];
    }
    for(int i=0;i<s.length();i++){
        temp[i]=temp[i-1];
    }
    return temp;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Given a map, return true if all keys are strings in lower 
case or all keys are strings in upper case, else return false.
The function should return false is the given map is empty.
Examples:
check_map_case({{"a","apple"}, {"b","banana"}}) should return true.
check_map_case({{"a","apple"}, {"A","banana"}, {"B","banana"}}) should return false.
check_map_case({{"a","apple"}, {"8","banana"}, {"a","apple"}}) should return false.
check_map_case({{"Name","John"}, {"Age","36"}, {"City","Houston"}}) should return false.
check_map_case({{"STATE","NC"}, {"ZIP","12345"} }) should return true.
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
#include<map>
using namespace std;
bool check_dcit_case(map<string,string> dict){
    for(map<string,string>::iterator it=dict.begin();it!=dict.end();it++){
        if(it->first.length()>0){
            if(it->first[0]>='A' && it->first[0]<='Z'){
                return true;
            }
        }
        else{
            if(it->first[0]>='a' && it->first[0]<='z'){
                return true;
            }
        }
    }
    return false;
}
bool check_map_case(map<string,string> dict){
    for(map<string,string>::iterator it=dict.begin();it!=dict.end();it++){
        if(it->first.length()>0){
            if(it->first[0]>='A' && it->first[0]<='Z'){
                return true;
            }
        }
        else{
            if(it->first[0]>='a' && it->first[0]<='z'){
                return true;
            }
        }
    }
    return false;
}
